box2d

Class B2DCamera

  • java.lang.Object
    • box2d.B2DCamera

  • public class B2DCamera
extends java.lang.Object
    The B2DCamera class is used to convert the Box2D-World coordinates to pixel coordinates and the other way around. This class resembles a camera with its own position and magnification, so it can be moved and zoomed like an actual camera.

    The B2DCamera also contains a follow-feature to track objects on screen (with speed and acceleration to make the movements smooth)

    • Field Detail

      • zoomStart

        private final float zoomStart
        Holds the default zoom value in case of a reset.

      • zoom

        private float zoom
        Holds the current zoom value. The value given defines how many screen pixels are equivalent to one metre in the Box2D World, so a smaller value zooms out and a bigger value zooms into the scene.

      • maxZoomOut

        private static float maxZoomOut
        Holds the static value for the maximum the B2DCamera can zoom out.

      • maxZoomIn

        private static float maxZoomIn
        Holds the static value for the maximum the B2DCamera can zoom in.

      • posCam

        private org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 posCam
        Holds the current position Vec2 vector of the centre of this B2DCamera instance.

      • posCamStart

        private final org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 posCamStart
        Holds the default position Vec2 vector in case of a reset.

      • resCam

        private org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 resCam
        Holds the pixel resolution of the B2DCamera. It is used to calculate the centre of the B2DCamera and has to be updated if the resolution changes.

      • followXEnabled

        private boolean followXEnabled
        Holds the information whether the camera should follow the given coordinate in the x direction.

      • followYEnabled

        private boolean followYEnabled
        Holds the information whether the camera should follow the given coordinate in the y direction.

      • followMaxAccel

        private static float followMaxAccel
        Holds the value for the maximum acceleration the B2DCamera can experience. The higher this value, the snappier the movement looks.

      • followResistance

        private static float followResistance
        Holds the amount of resistance the camera movement experiences. 1.0f resembles no friction at all, the lower the value, the more languorous the camera gets and the smoother the movement looks.

      • followSpeed

        private org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 followSpeed
        Holds the currents speed Vec2 vector of the B2DCamera.

    • Constructor Detail

      • B2DCamera

        public B2DCamera(float zoom_in,
                 org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in,
                 org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 res_in)
        Initialises a new B2DCamera instance. The zoom_in value defines how many screen pixels are equivalent to one metre in the Box2D World, so a small value zooms out of and a big value zooms into the scene. The pos_in Vec2 vector sets the centre position of the B2DCamera and the res_in Vec2 vector specifies the size of the Screen resolution (in px) this B2DCamera instance belongs to.
        Parameters:
        zoom_in - specifies the number of screen pixels for one metre
        pos_in - sets the position of the centre of the B2DCamera
        res_in - sets the pixel resolution of the Screen this instance belongs to

    • Method Detail

      • coordPixelsToWorld

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 coordPixelsToWorld(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 px_pos)
        Takes a pixel-coordinates point as a Vec2 vector and converts those to the correspondent Box2D-World coordinates. The current position and zoom of this B2DCamera instance is taken into account by the conversion calculation.

        Example: Use this method to create a body where a click has been registered.

        Parameters:
        px_pos - is the pixel-coordinate input vector (Vec2(x, y))
        Returns:
        the converted Box2D-World coordinates vector

      • coordPixelsToWorld

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 coordPixelsToWorld(float px_x,
                                                 float px_y)
        Takes the x and y values of the pixel-coordinates and converts those to the correspondent Box2D-World coordinates. The current position and zoom of this B2DCamera instance is taken into account by the conversion calculation.

        Example: Use this method to create a body where a click has been registered.

        Parameters:
        px_x - x part of the input pixel-coordinates
        px_y - y part of the input pixel-coordinates
        Returns:
        the converted Box2D-World coordinates vector

      • coordPixelsToWorld

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 coordPixelsToWorld(double px_x,
                                                 double px_y)
        Takes the x and y values of the pixel-coordinates and converts those to the correspondent Box2D-World coordinates. The current position and zoom of this B2DCamera instance is taken into account by the conversion calculation.

        Example: Use this method to create a body where a click has been registered.

        Parameters:
        px_x - x part of the input pixel-coordinates
        px_y - y part of the input pixel-coordinates
        Returns:
        the converted Box2D-World coordinates vector

      • coordWorldToPixels

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 coordWorldToPixels(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 B2D_pos)
        Takes a Box2D-World coordinates point as a Vec2 vector and converts those to the correspondent pixel-coordinates. The current position and zoom of this B2DCamera instance is taken into account by the conversion calculation.

        Example: Use this method to render a B2DBody on screen

        Parameters:
        B2D_pos - is the Box2D-World coordinate input vector
        Returns:
        the converted pixel-coordinates vector

      • rotateVec2

        public static org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 rotateVec2(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 v,
                                                float rad)
        Takes a Vec2 vector and a rotation value (in radiant) and rotates the vector by the value. This method doesn't modify the input vector, instead it returns a new Vec2 vector instance.
        Parameters:
        v - input vector to be rotated
        rad - rotation amount (in radiant and counterclockwise)
        Returns:
        a new rotated Vec2 instance

      • getRotation

        public static float getRotation(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 v)
        Takes a Vec2 vector and returns its argument (rotation). The return value is given in radiant counterclockwise starting at the positive x-axis. Special cases (0°, 90°, 180° and 270°) are considered.
        Parameters:
        v - input vector
        Returns:
        argument (rotation) of the input vector

      • scalarPixelsToWorld

        public float scalarPixelsToWorld(float px_f)
        Takes a pixel-scalar and returns the corresponding Box2D-World value. The current zoom of this B2DCamera instance is taken into account by the conversion calculation.

        Example: Use this method to move a B2DBody by a distance dragged on screen.

        Parameters:
        px_f - input pixel scalar
        Returns:
        converted Box2D-World scalar

      • scalarPixelsToWorld

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 scalarPixelsToWorld(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 px_vec)
        Takes two pixel-scalars (as a Vec2 instance) and returns the corresponding Box2D-World values. The current zoom of this B2DCamera instance is taken into account by the conversion calculation.

        Example: Use this method to move a B2DBody by a x and y distance dragged on screen.

        Parameters:
        px_vec - input pixel scalar pair (Vec2 instance)
        Returns:
        converted Box2D-World scalar pair (Vec2 instance)

      • scalarWorldToPixels

        public float scalarWorldToPixels(float B2D_f)
        Takes a Box2D-World scalar and returns the corresponding pixel value. The current zoom of this B2DCamera instance is taken into account by the conversion calculation.

        Example: Use this method to calculate the pixel radius of a B2DBody circle for rendering

        Parameters:
        B2D_f - input Box2D-World scalar
        Returns:
        converted pixel scalar

      • scalarWorldToPixels

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 scalarWorldToPixels(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 B2D_vec)
        Takes a Box2D-World scalar pair and returns the corresponding pixel values. The current zoom of this B2DCamera instance is taken into account by the conversion calculation.

        Example: Use this method to calculate the pixel height and width of a B2DBody rectangle for rendering

        Parameters:
        B2D_vec - input Box2D-World scalar pair (Vec2 instance)
        Returns:
        converted pixel scalar pair (Vec2 instance)

      • getZoom

        public float getZoom()
        Returns the current zoom value of this B2DCamera instance. The value represents the number of screen pixels equivalent to one metre in the Box2D World, so if zoomed out, this method returns a small value and the other way around.
        Returns:
        amount of pixels equivalent to one Box2D World metre

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(float zoom_in)
        Sets the absolute zoom value. The value given defines how many screen pixels are equivalent to one metre in the Box2D World, so a smaller value zooms out and a bigger value zooms into the scene.
        Parameters:
        zoom_in - sets the zoom of this B2DCamera instance

      • zoomCenter

        public void zoomCenter(float magnification)
        Zooms into or out of the scene by the magnification factor. A magnification value under 1.0f zooms out and a magnification value over 1.0f zooms into the scene. The centre of the zoom is always the centre of the view.
        Parameters:
        magnification - changes the zoom of this B2DCamera instance by its factor

      • zoomInPoint

        public void zoomInPoint(float magnification,
                        org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 B2DCenterPos,
                        boolean respectLockDirs)
        Zooms into or out of the scene by the magnification factor given while keeping the Box2D point given at the exact same location on screen. A magnification value under 1.0f zooms out and a magnification value over 1.0f zooms into the scene. The coordinate given is the centre of the zoom and is usually set to the cursor's position. If respectLockDirs is true the zoom process only centres the not-locked directions of this B2DCamera instance.
        Parameters:
        magnification - changes the zoom of this B2DCamera instance by its factor
        B2DCenterPos - defines the centre of the zoom (in Box2D coordinates)
        respectLockDirs - centres the zoom only in the unlocked directions if true

      • addPosLock

        public void addPosLock(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in,
                       boolean respectLockDirs)
        Takes Box2D World Vec2 vector and moves this B2DCamera instance by this vector. If respectLockDirs is true the B2DCamera will only move in free directions.
        Parameters:
        pos_in - moves this B2DCamera instance
        respectLockDirs - moves only in unlocked directions if true

      • getPos

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 getPos()
        Returns the current position of this B2DCamera instance. The coordinates are given in Box2D coordinates as a Vec2 vector.
        Returns:
        the location of this B2DCamera instance

      • setPos

        public void setPos(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in)
        Takes Box2D World coordinates as a Vec2 vector and sets the centre of this B2DCamera instance.
        Parameters:
        pos_in - sets the centre position of this B2DCamera instance

      • addPos

        public void addPos(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 pos_in)
        Takes Box2D World Vec2 vector and moves this B2DCamera instance by this vector.
        Parameters:
        pos_in - moves this B2DCamera instance

      • setScreenRes

        public void setScreenRes(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 res_in)
        Takes a pixel Vec2 vector and sets the screen to a new resolution.
        Parameters:
        res_in - sets the resolution of this B2DCamera instance

      • enableFollow

        public void enableFollow()
        Enables the follow feature for both axis. The B2DCamera tracks a given coordinate or object in all directions.

      • enableFollowX

        public void enableFollowX()
        Enables the follow feature for the x-axis. The B2DCamera only tracks a given coordinate or object in the x-direction. This method does not disable the y-follow.

      • enableFollowY

        public void enableFollowY()
        Enables the follow feature for the y-axis. The B2DCamera only tracks a given coordinate or object in the y-direction. This method does not disable the x-follow.

      • disableFollow

        public void disableFollow()
        Disables the follow feature for both axis. The B2DCamera does not track any given coordinate or object.

      • followXEnabled

        public boolean followXEnabled()
        Gives true when the B2DCamera is following in the x-axis.
        Returns:
        follow feature is enabled for the x-axis

      • followYEnabled

        public boolean followYEnabled()
        Gives true when the B2DCamera is following in the y-axis.
        Returns:
        follow feature is enabled for the y-axis

      • refreshFollow

        public void refreshFollow(float dt,
                          float playBackSpeed,
                          org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 B2D_target)
        This method has to be called very frame with a Box2D-World coordinate this B2DCamera instance has to follow. The time since the last frame dt is used to calculate the acceleration and speed of this B2DCamera instance. To adjust for the faster movement when fast-forwarding, pass the current playBackSpeed to this method. If the follow had been restricted to an axis the camera will only move along the specified axis.
        Parameters:
        dt - delta time, time in-between frames
        playBackSpeed - current speed of the simulation
        B2D_target - coordinate this B2DCamera instance has to follow

      • quickFollow

        public void quickFollow(org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 B2D_target)
        Takes a Box2D World coordinate and moves this B2DCamera instance instantly to the target point. If the follow had been restricted to an axis the camera will only move along the specified axis.
        Parameters:
        B2D_target - coordinate this B2DCamera instance jumps to

      • resetPosZoom

        public void resetPosZoom()
        Resets the position and zoom of this B2DCamera instance to the values it had been initialised with.

      • resetPos

        public void resetPos()
        Resets only the position of this B2DCamera instance to the coordinates it had been initialised at.
